epd_metadata.owner_address: Level 40, Northpoint Tower, 100 Miller St, North Sydney NSW 2060, Australia
epd_metadata.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

product_description.product_use: Concrete prepared by mixing cement, coarse and fine aggregates, and water, with or without auxiliary agents and additives, placed on building site or prefabricated in factory moulds, compacted and hardened by hydration of cement.

product_classes.normal_class: Designed for everyday applications such as residential and commercial foundations, driveways and footpaths.
product_classes.special_class: Supplied to major construction projects including high rise buildings, dams, spillways, roads, bridges, public works infrastructure; includes high-strength, high-durability, marine application, post-tensioned, high-pumpability, super workable, piling concrete, architectural off-form finishes and decorative applications.

product_description.hazardous_substances: None of the products contain substances listed in the Candidate List of Substances of Very High Concern for authorisation.
product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging.

lca_information.scope: Cradle to gate (modules A1-A3) with options (modules A4-A5), modules C1-C4 and module D
lca_information.reference_service_life: Not specified; scope is cradle to delivery

background_data_preferences: Product specific EPDs for cements, admixtures, pigments and fibres
Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI v1.42) (2023)

allocation.method: Physical allocation based on weight or m³ of concrete; economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible

excluded: Environmental impact from infrastructure, production equipment, and tools not directly consumed
Personnel-related impacts such as transportation to/from work
cut_off_criteria.included: All materials required for manufacturing delivered without packaging; packaging only excluded if not present

data_quality.geographic_representativeness: Good to very good for all data sources
data_quality.temporal_representativeness: Data updated within 10 years as required

system_boundaries.upstream_processes: Raw material extraction, transport, manufacturing, electricity generation
system_boundaries.core_processes: External and internal transport, concrete manufacturing, waste and wastewater treatment
system_boundaries.downstream_processes: Distribution, installation, construction waste, deconstruction, waste transport and treatment

installation.assumptions: Based on industrial expertise and GCCA tool; includes pouring from truck and pump, manual finishing; excludes pre-installation activities

deconstruction.process: Physical drilling and removal using hydraulic excavator

benefits_and_loads_beyond_system_boundar.recycled_aggregate_use: Recycled aggregate replaces virgin coarse aggregate depending on product performance requirements

carbon_emission_context.carbonation_note: CO2 absorption by concrete over lifetime (carbonation) is recognized but not included in this EPD's results
carbon_emission_context.carbon_footprint_reporting: Includes cradle to gate and options, excludes use stage emissions

allocation_method.fly_ash: Treated as waste material; only transport impacts included
allocation_method.ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag: Economic allocation due to significant economic value
allocation_method.silica_fume: Treated as waste material; only transport impacts included

recycled_materials_handling.background_data_allocation: AusLCI LCA database allocation approach adopted for secondary data and processes

disclaimers: Results of some environmental impact indicators have high uncertainties or limited experience.
Ionising radiation indicator excludes nuclear accidents, occupational exposure, radioactive waste disposal underground, and natural soil/radon radiation.
GWP-GHG (IPCC AR5) excludes biogenic carbon and indirect radiative forcing.

other_life_cycle_stages_not_included.description: LCA and EPD consider cradle to gate with options and end of life modules; other stages like use phase emissions, maintenance, repair, replacement, refurbishment, operational energy and water use are excluded.
other_life_cycle_stages_not_included.carbonation: Natural CO2 absorption by concrete over lifetime (carbonation) is recognized but not included in EPD results.

references: Australian Life Cycle Inventory Database Initiative Guidelines (2023)
British Standards Institution BS EN 15804:2012+A2:2019 and BS EN 16757:2017
Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water National Waste Report 2022
EPD International General Programme Instructions and PCR 2019:14 V1.3.4 (2024)
Man Yu et al., The Carbon Footprint of Australia's Construction Sector, Procedia Engineering, 2017
